data.title: left-hand drive
data.meta_description: LEFT-HAND DRIVE meaning: 1. A left-hand drive vehicle has the steering wheel on the left-hand side. 2. a vehicle that has…. Learn more.
data.text:
adjective

us

Your browser doesn't support HTML5 audio

/ˌleft.hænd ˈdraɪv/ uk

Your browser doesn't support HTML5 audio

/ˌleft.hænd ˈdraɪv/

left-hand drive

noun

us

Your browser doesn't support HTML5 audio

/ˌleft.hænd ˈdraɪv/ uk

Your browser doesn't support HTML5 audio

/ˌleft.hænd ˈdraɪv/

[ C ]

a vehicle that has the steering wheel on the left-hand side:

Both a left-hand drive and a right-hand drive will be manufactured at this plant.

She bought a left-hand drive.

Henrik5000/iStock/Getty Images Plus/GettyImages

[ U ]

a vehicle driving system in which the controls are on the left-hand side of the car:

In the Netherlands, traffic regulations prescribe right-hand use of road and vehicles generally have left-hand drive.

More examplesFewer examples

The left-hand drive is shipped from Mexico.

He forgot it was a left-hand drive and opened the wrong front door.

The manufacturer offers left-hand drive only.

(Definition of left-hand drive from the Cambridge Advanced Learner's Dictionary & Thesaurus © Cambridge University Press)

con el volante a la izquierda, coche con el volante a la izquierda…

in Portuguese

com a direção do lado esquerdo, carro com a direção do lado esquerdo…
